report_title: Heavy Duty Truck Parts Dealers Industry Report
executive_summary: The Heavy Duty Truck Parts Dealers industry has experienced an overall decline in revenue in recent years. Industry revenue has benefited from an increase in the average age of vehicle fleet, which increased demand from truck repair and maintenance service providers. However, truck manufacturers demanded fewer heavy duty truck parts during the period, harming revenue growth. The COVID-19 pandemic negatively affected industry revenue, with steel prices increasing and demand from downstream markets decreasing in 2020. While overall positive trends are expected to have supported industry revenue in the years following 2020, the industry has not yet fully recovered.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pandemic-related restrictions cut out need for transportation
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Measures taken to combat the spread of COVID-19 caused key downstream industries to experience significant slowdowns, eating into demand for freight trucking from construction, manufacturing, wholesale and retail markets. Stay-at-home measures limited the need for individual transportation, causing demand for buses to fall. Decreased consumer confidence and disposable income drove down business activity overall, lessening the need for freight trucking.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Recovering Economy Lifts Up Truck and Bus Use
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As the economy reopened following the COVID-19 pandemic, trucks were called into action to distribute higher quantities of goods across the country. The end of stay-at-home measures enabled people to travel freely, increasing demand for buses. Although revenue greatly increased following the height of the pandemic, this growth was not enough to offset declines completely.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Emissions Regulations Increase Demand for Parts
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Increased environmental regulations often require truck fleets to replace truck parts or retire older trucks to meet fuel-emission requirements, which increases demand for heavy duty truck parts sold by industry operators.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increased Demand and Investment are Set to Drive Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Rising consumer and business confidence will lead to increased investment in transportation. Corporate profit will steadily rise, leading to increased business activity and demand for freight trucking. The price of crude oil will continue to steadily make its way back down to pre-pandemic levels, increasing the appeal of trucks. As spending remains high, goods will continue to be shipped across the country, causing steady demand, especially as wear and tear on existing trucks necessitates upgrades.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Government Investment and Regulation Will Likely Have Mixed Effects
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the coming years, the government is set to pass increasingly stringent restrictions truck emissions, as well as make continued investments into multiple modes of transportation.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry primarily engage in the merchant wholesale distribution of truck parts and supplies for heavy duty and commercial trucks. Products include engine parts, differentials, transmissions, suspensions and cabs. New tires and tubes are excluded.
key_trends: The Heavy Duty Truck Parts Dealers industry is highly competitive.
Given that industry operators usually sell the same or very similar products, competition is primarily driven by price and the quality of service provision.

The Heavy Duty Truck Parts Dealers industry contends with limited external competition. Truck transportation plays a very important role in the transport of freight in the United States, with train, air and other forms of transport offering relatively little serious competition.
The industry experienced a sharp decline in 2020 amid the COVID-19 pandemic. While growth has followed, the industry is not expected to have yet fully recovered.
Revenue for truck parts dealers largely depends on downstream demand.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Heavy and medium truck manufacturers account for the largest market segment. Many have direct supply relationships with wholesalers.
Bus manufacturers are the third largest market segment.
The aftermarket segment includes collision repair shops, mechanical repair shops and other truck service providers that require aftermarket parts.

products_and_services.product_description: Mechanical parts for heavy trucks such as brake pads, filters, engines, drivetrain and suspension components.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Heavy Truck Exterior and Structural Parts
products_and_services.product_description: Exterior and structural parts for heavy trucks such as mirrors, windows, bumpers, roofs, side fairings, trailer doors.
Electronic components and systems for heavy trucks such as entertainment devices, cameras, sensors, emissions controls.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Medium Truck and Bus Mechanical Parts
products_and_services.product_description: Mechanical parts for medium trucks and buses.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Medium Truck and Bus Exterior and Structural Parts
products_and_services.product_description: Exterior and structural parts for medium trucks and buses.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Truck transportation service providers source replacement parts from heavy duty truck parts dealers.
Mechanical, exterior and structural components like brake pads, filters, engines, mirrors, bumpers account for the largest share of industry revenue.
Sales of truck electronics like entertainment systems, cameras, sensors are the fastest-growing revenue source as new technologies are adopted in trucks.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is the most populous region and home to major transportation hubs like Miami, Atlanta and Tampa, leading to the most industry locations.
The West has the second most locations, with California having the most of any state due to its large population and access to Asian trade through ports.
The Great Lakes region is a crossroads for truck traffic between the US and Canada and is home to the heart of the US auto industry, attracting parts suppliers.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Heavy Duty Truck Parts Dealers Industry is subject to several federal, state and local regulations and environmental laws.
Heavy duty truck parts dealers are bound to the Department of Labor's regulations.
NSF International provides standards development, product certification.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry has high revenue volatility.

basis_points.basis_description: Competition is primarily driven by price and the quality of service provision.
The industry contends with limited external competition.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are the Industry's Largest Cost
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases represent the largest cost for operators.
Wages are expected to remain relatively unchanged.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Larger enterprises may be more able to fund and adopt new costly technologies.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Heavy Duty Truck Parts Dealers' revenue largely depends on the size, age and overall usage.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Truck parts manufacturers are constantly innovating new products.

FAQs.question: How do shifts in consumer preferences like increased health consciousness, digitalization and sustainability affect your business performance?
FAQs.answer: Consumers have been increasingly more conscious of the environment.

FAQs.question: Are your sales heavily dependent on any single market, major customer or other single revenue stream?
FAQs.answer: More than half of company sales are for mechanical parts.
